name: 戴楠青
objective: Technologically, this course reviews the recent developments on research-based interaction design. Theoretically, this course introduces the theories and methodologies of the research applications in the field of human-computer interaction and teaches how to design a HCI experiment.
schedule:
Week1.Introdction
Week2.Research Methods for Design I
Week3.Research Methods for Design II
Week4.Research Methods for Interaction Design I
Week5.Research Methods for Interaction Design II
Week6.Psychophysics
Week7.Human Subject Research I
Week8.Midterm Week
Week9.Human Subject Research II
Week10.Research Methods for Interaction Design III
Week11.Research Methods for Interaction Design IV
Week12.Data Analysis
Week13.Research Methods for Interaction Design V
Week14.Research Abstract Development
Week15.Research Development I
Week16.Research Development II
Week17.Research Development III
Week18.Final Week
materials: MacKenzie I. Scott (2013). Human-Computer Interaction: An Empirical Research Perspective. Morgan Kaufmann.
